intro: Hebeclinium guapulense, commonly known as the Guapulense hebeclinium, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Chile. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, preferring cool and humid climates. It produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
